name: Sweet Potato Toast (Vegan & Gluten-Free)
description: Have you tried sweet potato toast yet? It's insanely delicious, healthy, and completely vegan and gluten-free! Don't miss out on this new breakfast trend!
recipeIngredient: toppings of your choice ((you can find many suggestions above in the text) )

recipeInstructions.text: Vertically slice your sweet potatoes into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Don't make them too thick as they won't get cooked all through then.
recipeInstructions.name: Vertically slice your sweet potatoes into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Don't make them too thick as they won't get cooked all through then.

recipeInstructions.text: You can either peel the sweet potatoes or just leave the skin on. I usually don't mind the skin, but that's totally up to you. It works both ways.
recipeInstructions.name: You can either peel the sweet potatoes or just leave the skin on. I usually don't mind the skin, but that's totally up to you. It works both ways.

recipeInstructions.text: Turn the toaster all the way up to high and toast the sweet potato slices for 2-3 rounds or about 5 minutes. Spread the sweet potato toasts with the toppings of your choice. You can find many suggestions in the text above.
recipeInstructions.name: Turn the toaster all the way up to high and toast the sweet potato slices for 2-3 rounds or about 5 minutes. Spread the sweet potato toasts with the toppings of your choice. You can find many suggestions in the text above.

recipeInstructions.text: You can keep extra slices in an air-tight container in the fridge for up to one week. Just heat them up again in the toaster.
recipeInstructions.name: You can keep extra slices in an air-tight container in the fridge for up to one week. Just heat them up again in the toaster.
